<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Impressive Mount](/Feats.aspx?ID=1922) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 164 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Cavalier](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=53)

**Prerequisites**
[Cavalier Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1919)

</column>

---

You've trained your mount to become a powerful force on the battlefield. The mount you gained through the [Cavalier Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1919) feat becomes a [mature animal companion](/Rules.aspx?ID=155), granting it additional capabilities. During an encounter, even if you don't use the [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) action, your animal companion can still use 1 action on your turn to Stride or Strike.

<title level="2">Impressive Mount leads to...</title>
[Incredible Mount](/Feats.aspx?ID=1926)
name: Impressive Mount
